predJson.name: Comparative Risk of Kidney Failure with Intravitreal Anti-VEGF Medications

targetCohort.name: Adult patients aged ≥18 years newly treated with monthly intravitreal anti-VEGF medications (ranibizumab, aflibercept, or bevacizumab) for ≥3 months for blinding disease

comparatorCohort.name: Adult patients aged ≥18 years newly treated with monthly intravitreal anti-VEGF medications (ranibizumab, aflibercept, or bevacizumab) for ≥3 months for blinding disease

outcomeCohort.name: Kidney failure (administrative code-only definition with condition, observation, or procedure related to end-stage kidney disease)

timeAtRisks.description: On-treatment: After 3rd anti-VEGF exposure until end of continuous exposure (>180 day gap) or study end
Intent-to-treat sensitivity analysis: After 3rd anti-VEGF exposure until observation end

predJson.name: ACE Inhibitors vs ARBs and Thiazide Diuretics - Schizophrenia Risk

outcomeCohort.name: Schizophrenia - Primary Definition (≥1 diagnosis + ≥2 antipsychotic prescriptions or ≥2 psychiatric procedures)

negativeControlConceptSet.name: 26 Falsification Endpoints (ingrowing nails, fractures of upper limb, etc.)

conceptsToInclude.name: All baseline characteristics (demographics, diagnosis, medication, procedure history)

predJson.name: DOAC Comparative Safety and Effectiveness Study

targetCohort.name: DOAC exposure (varies by comparison: apixaban, dabigatran, rivaroxaban, or edoxaban)

outcomeCohort.name: Composite of ischemic stroke and systemic embolism

targetCohort.name: Famotidine users on day of admission

comparatorCohort.name: PPI users on day of admission

conceptsToInclude.name: All observed conditions within 30 days before or on admission

timeAtRisks.description: Intention-to-treat: 1 day after admission to 30 days after admission

targetCohort.name: PPI users (rabeprazole, pantoprazole, omeprazole, lansoprazole, ilaprazole, esomeprazole, dexlansoprazole) for 7+ days

comparatorCohort.name: H2RA users (ranitidine, nizatidine, lafutidine, famotidine, cimetidine) for 7+ days

outcomeCohort.name: Hospitalization with pneumonia, ARDS, sepsis, or AKI
Intensive respiratory interventions (mechanical ventilation, ECMO, or tracheostomy)

conceptsToExclude.name: PPIs and H2RAs within 180 days before index

psSettings.description: One-to-four exact PSM with greedy nearest method

predJson.name: DOACs vs Warfarin Severe Uterine Bleeding Study

targetCohort.name: Adult female new users of DOACs (rivaroxaban, apixaban, or dabigatran) with AF or VTE indication

comparatorCohort.name: Adult female new users of warfarin with AF or VTE indication

outcomeCohort.name: Severe uterine bleeding (vaginal bleeding with blood transfusion on same day or surgical management within 60 days)

conceptsToInclude.name: All baseline covariates including demographics, prior conditions, medication use, procedures, Charlson Comorbidity Index, and CHA2DS2-VASc

timeAtRisks.description: Primary on-treatment: DOACs 3-day gap + 5 days; Warfarin 7-day gap + 5 days
Sensitivity analysis 1: 30-day gap, no days appended

predJson.name: Comparative Effectiveness of Cu IUD vs LNG-IUS on Cervical Neoplasm Incidence

timeAtRisks.description: Primary analysis: 30 days to 15 years after IUD placement
Subgroup analysis: at least 1 year after IUD placement

targetCohort.name: T2DM patients with established CVD on metformin monotherapy initiating second-line antihyperglycemic agent (SGLT2i, GLP-1 RA, DPP4i, or SU)

comparatorCohort.name: T2DM patients with established CVD on metformin monotherapy initiating alternative second-line antihyperglycemic agent

outcomeCohort.name: 3-point MACE (acute MI, stroke, sudden cardiac death)
4-point MACE (acute MI, stroke, sudden cardiac death, hospitalization for HF)

negativeControlConceptSet.name: 100 negative control outcomes selected through data-driven algorithm

psSettings.description: PS stratification or matching based on SMD <0.15

predJson.name: Ranitidine vs Other H2RAs Cancer Risk Study

targetCohort.name: Adult patients aged 20+ years using ranitidine for more than 30 days

comparatorCohort.name: Adult patients aged 20+ years using other H2RAs (famotidine, roxatidine, or lafutidine)

outcomeCohort.name: Any cancer types excluding nonmelanoma skin cancer
Any cancer types including nonmelanoma skin cancer and excluding thyroid cancer
Lip, oral cavity, and pharynx cancer
Gall bladder and biliary tract cancer

conceptsToInclude.name: Year and month of cohort entry
All recorded medications in the year prior
Medical history in the year prior
Procedures performed in the year prior
Charlson Comorbidity Index score in the year prior

predJson.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Safety Monitoring - Comparative Cohort Analysis

targetCohort.name: First Janssen Ad26.COV2.S COVID-19 vaccine with 365 days prior observation

comparatorCohort.name: First Moderna mRNA-1273 COVID-19 vaccine with 365 days prior observation

conceptsToInclude.name: All baseline covariates (demographics, conditions, drug exposures, procedures)

psSettings.description: Variable ratio matching on propensity score

predJson.name: Semaglutide and NAION Risk - Active Comparator New User Cohort Study

comparatorCohort.name: Adults 18+ with T2D taking dulaglutide, exenatide, empagliflozin, sitagliptin, or glipizide

outcomeCohort.name: NAION - Sensitive Definition (1 ischemic optic neuropathy diagnosis code)
NAION - Specific Definition (2 confirmatory ischemic optic neuropathy diagnosis codes within 90 days)

conceptsToInclude.name: All baseline characteristics (demographics, preexisting conditions, medications, procedures)

timeAtRisks.description: On-treatment: From medication initiation until end of continuous drug exposure (gap >30 days)

predJson.name: Stroke Risk in Elderly Antipsychotic Users
Ticagrelor vs Clopidogrel in ACS Patients Post-PCI

targetCohort.name: Adult ACS patients who underwent PCI and received ticagrelor within 7 days before index date

comparatorCohort.name: Adult ACS patients who underwent PCI and received clopidogrel within 7 days before index date

outcomeCohort.name: Net adverse clinical events (NACE): recurrent AMI, revascularization, ischemic stroke, hemorrhagic stroke, or gastrointestinal bleeding
Composite ischemic events: recurrent AMI, revascularization, or ischemic stroke
Composite hemorrhagic events: hemorrhagic stroke or gastrointestinal bleeding
Major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE): cardiovascular mortality, recurrent AMI, and stroke

negativeControlConceptSet.name: 96 falsification endpoints using data-rich algorithm (e.g., chalazion, pneumothorax)

predJson.name: Tramadol vs Codeine Hip Fracture Study

outcomeCohort.name: Hip Fracture (O1 - READ codes for CPRD)
Hip Fracture (O2 - Standard codes for US claims)

predJson.name: Remicade NIU Risk Assessment - Active Comparator New User Cohort Study

targetCohort.name: New users of Remicade (stratified by indication: IBD, AS, PsO/PsA, RA with methotrexate)

comparatorCohort.name: New users of alternative biologics (indication-specific, excluding etanercept and adalimumab)

conceptsToInclude.name: Demographics, risk indices, diagnoses, drug exposures, procedures, devices, laboratory measurements
